		NBA stars sound ready for Saudi-backed basketball after Kylian Mbappe’s $776 million Al Hilal offer	


	
			
		By
		
				
			
				Social Links for			
			Erich Richter			
			
			
				

							
			
				View Author Archive
			
		

				
			
				Email the Author
			
		

				
			
				Follow on Twitter
			
		

				
			
				Get author RSS feed
			
		

		
				
			

		

	


	
		
			
								
					
				
			
			
			Contact The Author





Name(required)

	



Email(required)

	



Comment(required)

	

	
		Submit		
		
		
	

Δ


			

		

	



	


	
		
			
								
					
				
			
			
			

	
		
	

	
		Thanks for contacting us. We've received your submission.	

		
		Back to Reading	


			

		

	



		

			
			Published 
			July 25, 2023
		

	
			
			Updated 
			July 25, 2023, 4:30 p.m. ET
		

	

	


						


						



						
							

		
			
	
		
			More On:
							
					LeBron James				
						


		
			
									
						
							
								Why LeBron was almost brought ‘to tears’ while watching Bronny: ‘Crazy man!’							
						

					

										
						
							
								Celebrity tattoo artist Bang Bang plans to turn new ‘magic ink’ into sunscreen and diabetes warnings							
						

					

										
						
							
								LeBron James watches son Bronny’s game while giving postgame interview							
						

					

										
						
							
								LeBron not certain to play for Lakers next season: NBA insider							
						

					

								
		


	



		
		


Don’t expect a Rory Mcllroy-esque stand from LeBron James and other fellow NBA stars if and when the Saudi Arabian money comes knocking. 



Upon reports of the Saudi Arabian soccer club Al Hilal offering slightly north of $776 million for one year of PSG forward Kylian Mbappe; James was joined by Damian Lillard, Draymond Green, and Giannis Antetokounmpo, who were shocked by the money being offered. 



Lillard tweeted his reaction to the contract offer, writing “1 year 776mm? Wtf lol ...” 



A few hours later, James would tweet his own GIF of Forrest Gump running with the caption, “Me headed to Saudi when they call @RichPaul4 & @mavcarter for that 1 year deal!”




Me headed to Saudi when they call @RichPaul4 & @mavcarter for that 1 year deal! ✌‍♂️ pic.twitter.com/IX0VSMZYNb
— LeBron James (@KingJames) July 25, 2023





Antetokounmpo also wanted in the on action. 



“Al Hilal you can take me. I look like Kylian Mbappe,” he said, alongside a close-up photo.



Recently re-signed Warriors forward Draymond Green also tweeted, “They got basketball leagues too, right? I don’t [think] the ink on my contract has dried up yet.”



The Saudis do have a basketball league known as the Saudi Basketball League (SBL). 



Mahmoud Abdul-Rauf is the most noteworthy player to ever compete in the league when he joined in 2007. 




	

LeBron James Getty Images


Saudi Arabia has successfully infiltrated the sports world, including with LIV Golf, where they poached multiple top golfers from the PGA Tour. 



The results were as good as they could’ve hoped for, with LIV and PGA agreeing to merge pending approval, reunifying golf and bringing Saudi Arabian oil money into the fold. 



Their Private Investment Fund (PIF) also helped purchase Newcastle United, a Premier League soccer team. 




	

Yasir Al-Rumayyan is the head of Saudi Arabia’s PIF and the Newcastle chairman Getty Images


PIF was also heavily involved in bringing Cristian Ronaldo to Al Nassr in January and offering Lionel Messi $400 million to join Al Hilal. 



Messi would go on to reject the offer and join MLS, but the emergence of Saudi Arabian oil money in sports is impossible to ignore. 



Saudi Arabia is also expected to be heavily involved in the bid for the 2030 World Cup, with their primary goal being to diversify funds and become less reliant on oil. 







It is entirely unclear whether the PIF will ever enter basketball or American football, but many have speculated that this is a true elephant in the room. 



And it seems like the NBA players wouldn’t say no.

<p>Don’t expect a Rory Mcllroy-esque stand from LeBron James and other fellow NBA stars if and when the Saudi Arabian money comes knocking. </p>



<p>Upon reports of the Saudi Arabian soccer club Al Hilal offering slightly north of $776 million for one year of PSG forward Kylian Mbappe; James was joined by Damian Lillard, Draymond Green, and Giannis Antetokounmpo, who were shocked by the money being offered. </p>



<p>Lillard tweeted his reaction to the contract offer, <a href="https://twitter.com/Dame_Lillard/status/1683564721675567104" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">writing</a> “1 year 776mm? Wtf lol ...” <a href="https://twitter.com/Dame_Lillard/status/1683564721675567104" target="_blank"></a></p>



<p>A few hours later, James would tweet his own GIF of Forrest Gump running with the caption, “Me headed to Saudi when they call <a href="https://twitter.com/RichPaul4?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1683634303203422209%7Ctwgr%5Ef9d01f2e9a4f7cd13a06e7b6c0d026dac53d4353%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fnypost.com%2Fwp-admin%2Fpost.php%3Fpost%3D28029490action%3Dedit" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">@RichPaul4</a> & <a href="https://twitter.com/mavcarter?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1683634303203422209%7Ctwgr%5Ef9d01f2e9a4f7cd13a06e7b6c0d026dac53d4353%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fnypost.com%2Fwp-admin%2Fpost.php%3Fpost%3D28029490action%3Dedit" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">@mavcarter</a> for that 1 year deal!”</p>



<figure class="wp-block-embed is-type-rich is-provider-twitter wp-block-embed-twitter"><div class="wp-block-embed__wrapper">
<div class="embed-wrapper twitter"><blockquote class="twitter-tweet" data-width="550" data-dnt="true"><p lang="en" dir="ltr">Me headed to Saudi when they call <a href="https://twitter.com/RichPaul4?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw" target="_blank">@RichPaul4</a> & <a href="https://twitter.com/mavcarter?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw" target="_blank">@mavcarter</a> for that 1 year deal! ✌‍♂️ <a href="https://t.co/IX0VSMZYNb" target="_blank">pic.twitter.com/IX0VSMZYNb</a></p>
— LeBron James (@KingJames) <a href="https://twitter.com/KingJames/status/1683634303203422209?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw" target="_blank">July 25, 2023</a></blockquote></div>

</div>
</figure>


<p>Antetokounmpo also wanted in the on action. </p>



<p>“Al Hilal you can take me. I look like Kylian Mbappe,” <a href="https://twitter.com/Giannis_An34/status/1683549442287255552" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">he said</a>, alongside a close-up photo.</p>



<p>Recently re-signed Warriors forward Draymond Green also tweeted, “They got basketball leagues too, right? I don’t [think] the ink on my contract has dried up yet.”</p>



<p>The Saudis do have a basketball league known as the Saudi Basketball League (SBL). </p>



<p>Mahmoud Abdul-Rauf is the most noteworthy player to ever compete in the league when he joined in 2007. </p>

100vw, 1024px"></a><figcaption>LeBron James <span class="credit">Getty Images</span></figcaption></figure>


<p>Saudi Arabia has successfully infiltrated the sports world, including with LIV Golf, where they poached multiple top golfers from the PGA Tour. </p>



<p>The results were as good as they could’ve hoped for, with <a href="https://nypost.com/2023/06/06/pga-tour-liv-golf-merging-in-stunning-end-to-sports-war/" target="_blank">LIV and PGA agreeing to merge</a> pending approval, reunifying golf and bringing Saudi Arabian oil money into the fold. </p>



<p>Their <a href="https://nypost.com/2023/06/06/pif-the-saudi-investment-fund-behind-pga-and-livs-merger/" target="_blank">Private Investment Fund</a> (PIF) also helped purchase Newcastle United, a Premier League soccer team. </p>

100vw, 1024px"></a><figcaption>Yasir Al-Rumayyan is the head of Saudi Arabia’s PIF and the Newcastle chairman <span class="credit">Getty Images</span></figcaption></figure>


<p>PIF was also heavily involved in bringing <a href="https://nypost.com/2022/12/30/ronaldo-joining-saudi-arabian-club-al-nassr-on-record-deal/" target="_blank">Cristian Ronaldo to Al Nassr in January</a> and offering Lionel Messi $400 million to join Al Hilal. </p>



<p>Messi would go on to reject the offer and join MLS, but the emergence of Saudi Arabian oil money in sports is impossible to ignore. </p>



<p>Saudi Arabia is also expected to be heavily involved in the bid for the 2030 World Cup, with their primary goal being to diversify funds and become less reliant on oil. </p>



<div class="comments-inline-cta" data-comment-count data-prompt="What do you think?"></div>



<p>It is entirely unclear whether the PIF will ever enter basketball or American football, but many have speculated that this is a true elephant in the room. </p>



<p>And it seems like the NBA players wouldn’t say no. </p>
